metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15930 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In ReadOneJNGImage in coders/png.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26, a Null Pointer Dereference occurs while transferring JPEG scanlines, related to a PixelPacket pointer. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-15930` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-16
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-16
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-16
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-16
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-16').
